オプション1: When Star Man looked straight ahead, a cylindrical object was coming toward him.
(Ah, crap. Is that a monster too?)

Because the monsters usually stood perfectly still, they were hard to spot,
and often he didn't notice them until they started coming his way.
(I see that one a lot... It's the one that does a charge attack.)
The monster was cylinder‑shaped, about the same size as the cubes.
(Should I try fighting it...?)
Star Man leveled his stone spear.

Star Man had spent a week fleeing monsters,
and in particular he had to dodge the shots the disk‑shaped enemy threw,
so his reflexes were honed.
<SHAAA!>
The cylindrical monster charged like a bull.
Star Man leapt sideways to dodge. Mud and leaves flew.
The cylindrical monster turned toward him and crept closer, inch by inch.

(I avoided it earlier because it was far away, but if it does that point‑blank...
I probably can't dodge it. If I have the bad luck to be trampled,
that could be instant death...)
Like the others, the cylindrical enemy looked to weigh hundreds of kilograms.
(I'll run.)

Star Man trotted away.
Even if you beat a monster, you couldn't eat it and got no materials,
so unless it was a road he used often or one he couldn't avoid, he ran.

After a while he reached an open place.
There was an old collapsed house.
It had straw and earthen walls, a type not seen today.
Human bones lay scattered inside the house.

(You don't end up with a house containing human bones if people were living normally.
This looks like there was an incident...)

Though hidden by grass, faint traces of a path led from the ruin into the forest.
Brushing aside with a wooden stick, Star Man proceeded that way.
Ahead lay a small graveyard and a shrine.
(!! A person...!)
An old woman was sitting in the graveyard.
Star Man spoke to her nervously.
(I really hope it's not another robot‑like person...)
"Got a minute?"
"Ah... Is it that time already...?"
The old woman sighed.
"I want to hear your story."
Silence passed between them.
"All right."
(Good... someone who understands speech...)
"I drifted ashore here."
"Pleased to meet you..."
"Yes, likewise."
"Tell me about the monsters all over the place. What are they?"
"Biological weapons. GEFORQE's experimental subjects dumped here."
GEFORQE was a developing country to the west of this island.

"They're not anything that advanced.
Things like making plants able to move, or implanting plant cells into animals—
that's all. Thanks to that they can live without eating or drinking."

On Poweregg Planet, genetic modification had spread to households and individuals,
and even developing countries created organisms for many purposes.
"I'd never heard news like that before."

"People don't come near this island.
You—didn't you make a pact with a demon?"
"Eh... ...Yeah."
"That demon goes to people on the brink of death and urges them to make a contract."
"Those who revive gain power.
"Once conflict breaks out, those with power can beat those without. They can kill."
"Those about to be killed—the powerless—make the demon pact and revive."
Star Man's expression grew grim.

"Those who've made the pact can use magic.
With training the magic becomes tremendously powerful and can kill many at once.
When many are killed, everyone makes the pact and revives."

"The number of contractors multiplied like doubling upon doubling.
But with the clause that you die in a year. That's how the island's people died out."
"The monsters started being dumped afterward."
"I see. So that's how it was."

(From the horned person's point of view,
if the islanders fought each other, they'd get lots of contracts...)

"One more thing. For my companions' sake I want to escape within a year.
Do you know any good way?"

"Can't think of anything... It'd be nice if you could get off the island.
Then the contract ends, too."
"? The contract ends?"
"Yeah. If you can leave the island, the contract disappears and you're saved."
"Really? How do you know that?"
"Eh? Why was it again...?"
(Is that really true...?)
"Anyway, thank you."
After this, Star Man gathered food and returned to the ruins.
